element_evaluations.element_description: Can a user or system discover and uniquely identify this dataset?

sub_elements.name: Persistent Identifier (DOI, RRID, or URI)
sub_elements.evidence: id: https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/DXWOS5
sub_elements.notes: DOI-based persistent identifier present in id field

sub_elements.name: Dataset Title and Description Completeness
sub_elements.evidence: title: Cell Maps for Artificial Intelligence (CM4AI); description: comprehensive 243-word overview covering scope, methods, data types, and deliverables
sub_elements.notes: Both title and extensive description present with comprehensive detail

sub_elements.name: Keywords or Tags for Searchability
sub_elements.evidence: 26 keywords covering: Cell Maps, AI-Ready Data, Bridge2AI, Protein-Protein Interactions, Spatial Proteomics, CRISPR, cell lines (MDA-MB-468, KOLF2.1J), technologies (AP-MS, SEC-MS, IF), FAIR Principles, RO-Crate, FAIRSCAPE
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive keyword list covering methods, technologies, standards, and scientific domains

sub_elements.name: Landing Page and Resources (page, hierarchical resources)
sub_elements.evidence: page: https://www.cm4ai.org
sub_elements.notes: Landing page URL provided; no hierarchical resources field (flat D4D schema)

sub_elements.name: Hierarchical Structure (parent datasets, relationships)
sub_elements.evidence: external_resources field contains 12 resource entries linking to project website, NIH RePORTER, Dataverse DOIs, bioRxiv publications, FAIRSCAPE docs, NDEx, Bridge2AI program, CFDE, MassIVE, NCBI SRA
sub_elements.notes: While parent_datasets and related_datasets fields not present (flat schema), extensive external resources provide comprehensive ecosystem connections

element_evaluations.element_description: Can the dataset and its associated resources be located, accessed, and downloaded?

sub_elements.name: Access Policy and IP Restrictions Defined
sub_elements.evidence: license_and_use_terms: comprehensive 12-line description of CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license including attribution requirements, commercial restrictions, share-alike terms, citation requirements, and Data Access Committee oversight; license_terms enumerated list with 5 key points
sub_elements.notes: Detailed access policy with license terms; no separate ip_restrictions field but covered in license description

sub_elements.name: Regulatory Restrictions and Confidentiality Level Specified
sub_elements.evidence: Fields not present
sub_elements.notes: No explicit regulatory_restrictions or confidentiality_level fields; license terms mention Data Access Committee oversight and dual licensing potential

sub_elements.name: Download URL or Platform Link Available
sub_elements.evidence: distribution_formats contains access_urls including: https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/DXWOS5, https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/B35XWX, https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/F3TD5R, https://www.cm4ai.org, MassIVE Repository, NCBI BioProject/SRA, https://www.ndexbio.org, LibraData University of Virginia
sub_elements.notes: Multiple access URLs across different data types and repositories; download_url field not present but access_urls in distribution_formats provide comprehensive access information

sub_elements.name: Distribution Formats and File Types Specified
sub_elements.evidence: 5 distribution_formats entries: RO-Crate Packages with Provenance (ARK/DOI identifiers, JSON-LD metadata), Mass Spectrometry Data in MassIVE, Sequence Data in NCBI SRA, Hierarchical Cell Maps in NDEx, University of Virginia Dataverse
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive distribution formats with detailed descriptions; format and media_type fields not explicitly present but formats described in detail

sub_elements.name: Related Datasets and External Resources Linked
sub_elements.evidence: 12 external_resources entries linking to: CM4AI website, NIH RePORTER, UVA Dataverse (3 DOIs), bioRxiv publication, FAIRSCAPE docs, IMP platform, NDEx, Bridge2AI program, CFDE, MassIVE, NCBI SRA, Perturbation Cell Atlas publication
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive external resources covering all major platforms and related publications; related_datasets field not present (flat schema)

element_evaluations.element_description: Is sufficient information provided to reuse and integrate the dataset with others?

sub_elements.name: License Terms Allow Reuse
sub_elements.evidence: CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 license with detailed terms: attribution required, non-commercial use allowed, share-alike requirements, citation guidance, commercial use requires separate license
sub_elements.notes: Clear reuse terms with both permissions and restrictions well-documented

sub_elements.name: Data Formats Are Standardized (encoding, format)
sub_elements.evidence: Fields not present at top level
sub_elements.notes: While distribution_formats describe RO-Crate, MassIVE, SRA, and NDEx formats, no explicit encoding or format fields at dataset level

sub_elements.name: Schema or Ontology Conformance Stated
sub_elements.evidence: Data mapped to: Gene Ontology (GO), Reactome, Protein Data Bank (PDB), AlphaFold, Schema.org, EVI Evidence Graph Ontology; keywords mapped to NCI Thesaurus, BioAssay Ontology, Cell Ontology, CHEBI; RO-Crate packages with JSON-LD using Schema.org and EVI vocabularies
sub_elements.notes: Extensive ontology and standard conformance described in cleaning_strategies and distribution_formats; conforms_to field not present but conformance comprehensively documented

sub_elements.name: Variable Metadata with Identifiers Defined
sub_elements.evidence: Field not present
sub_elements.notes: No variables field; dataset focuses on imaging, mass spec, and perturbation data rather than tabular variables

sub_elements.name: Use Guidance Provided (intended, prohibited uses)
sub_elements.evidence: 6 intended_uses entries covering AI/ML training, visible neural networks, genotype-phenotype mapping, drug response prediction, disease mechanisms, AI-ready dataset model; 3 discouraged_uses covering clinical use without validation, use during incomplete release, analysis without domain expertise
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive use guidance with both positive and negative guidance; prohibited_uses field not present but discouraged_uses effectively serves this purpose

element_evaluations.element_description: Does the dataset provide clear information about consent, privacy, and ethical oversight?

sub_elements.name: IRB or Ethics Review Documented
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research field with comprehensive documentation: involves_human_subjects: false (de-identified cell lines), irb_approval: 'Not applicable - de-identified cell lines from commercial sources', ethics_review_board: CM4AI Ethics Module (Vardit Ravitsky, Jean-Christophe Bélisle-Pipon), Data Access Committee (Jillian Parker), Bridge2AI Ethics Working Group participation
sub_elements.notes: Clear ethics documentation explaining non-human subjects research status with ethics oversight structure

sub_elements.name: Deidentification Method Described
sub_elements.evidence: human_subject_research description states data are 'de-identified as they cannot be matched, with current knowledge, to a human subject'; Both cell lines commercially available, ethically sourced, de-identified; sensitive_elements states 'cannot be matched to individuals with current knowledge'
sub_elements.notes: Deidentification status clearly documented; is_deidentified field not present as separate field but status comprehensively explained

sub_elements.name: Privacy Protections Beyond Deidentification
sub_elements.evidence: Ethics team developed comprehensive plan for ethical preparation, licensing, dissemination, and data access supervision balancing openness with IP protection and commercialization monitoring; Data Access Committee oversight; special_populations documented with de-identification status
sub_elements.notes: Privacy protections through Data Access Committee, ethical oversight, and commercial use monitoring; participant_privacy field not present but protections well-documented

sub_elements.name: Informed Consent Obtained from Participants
sub_elements.evidence: MDA-MB-468 from ATCC (established ethically sourced commercial cell line); KOLF2.1J from HipSci resource 'available for access by non-for-profit organizations via a simple MTA'; both described as 'ethically sourced'; human_subject_research states cell lines are commercially available and ethically sourced
sub_elements.notes: Original consent implicit in ethical sourcing from established repositories (ATCC, HipSci); informed_consent field not present but ethical sourcing documented

sub_elements.name: Vulnerable Populations and Compensation Documented
sub_elements.evidence: special_populations documented: 'MDA-MB-468 derived from 51-year-old black female (de-identified)', 'KOLF2.1J derived from healthy male Northern European donor (de-identified)'; cell line origins documented with de-identification emphasized
sub_elements.notes: Population demographics documented with de-identification; vulnerable_populations and participant_compensation fields not applicable for commercial cell lines but populations documented in special_populations

element_evaluations.element_description: Can the dataset's structure, modality, and population be understood from metadata?

sub_elements.name: Cohort or Subpopulations Characteristics Described
sub_elements.evidence: 7 subpopulations entries: MDA-MB-468 Untreated, MDA-MB-468 Paclitaxel-Treated, MDA-MB-468 Vorinostat-Treated, KOLF2.1J Undifferentiated iPSCs, KOLF2.1J iPSC-Derived Neurons, KOLF2.1J iPSC-Derived Neural Progenitor Cells, KOLF2.1J iPSC-Derived Cardiomyocytes
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive subpopulation documentation covering cell types, treatment conditions, and differentiation states

sub_elements.name: Number of Instances or Samples Reported
sub_elements.evidence: 4 instances entries with detailed descriptions: MDA-MB-468 Breast Cancer Cell Line (RRID:CVCL_0419, triple negative, 3 conditions), KOLF2.1J iPSCs (RRID:CVCL_B5P3, undifferentiated + derivatives), 100 Chromatin Regulators (17 genes tagged, 72/100 in SEC-MS, 52 in complexes), 100 Metabolic Enzymes
sub_elements.notes: Instances document primary cell lines and protein targets with specific quantitative details

sub_elements.name: Variable-Level Metadata and Tabular Flag
sub_elements.evidence: Fields not present
sub_elements.notes: No variables or is_tabular fields; dataset is multi-modal (imaging, mass spec, sequencing) rather than tabular

sub_elements.name: Data Topics or Conditions Represented
sub_elements.evidence: Instances document: triple negative breast cancer (MDA-MB-468), cancer/neuropsychiatric/cardiac disorders (KOLF2.1J applications), chromatin regulation, metabolic processes; treatment conditions (paclitaxel, vorinostat); differentiation states (neurons, cardiomyocytes, NPCs)
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive coverage of disease contexts, biological processes, and experimental conditions in instances field

sub_elements.name: Data Quality Issues and Anomalies Documented
sub_elements.evidence: sampling_strategies entry describes Disease-Relevant Cell Line Selection with is_sample: false, is_random: false, is_representative: false, and strategies listing purposive selection rationale; discouraged_uses mentions 'interim/beta release with data not yet in completed final form', 'temporary pre-publication embargo', 'protein interrogation sets incompletely overlap', 'computed cell maps not yet included'
sub_elements.notes: Sampling approach documented; quality limitations disclosed in discouraged_uses; anomalies field not present but quality issues well-documented

element_evaluations.element_description: Can a user determine dataset versions, update history, and provenance?

sub_elements.name: Dataset Version Number Provided
sub_elements.evidence: Field not present at top level; updates field mentions v0.5, V1.4, V2.1 but no current version number
sub_elements.notes: Version numbers mentioned in update_details but no top-level version field

sub_elements.name: Version Access Methods Documented
sub_elements.evidence: Field not present
sub_elements.notes: No version_access field; distribution_formats provide multiple DOIs but version access methods not explicitly documented

sub_elements.name: Change Descriptions and Errata Provided
sub_elements.evidence: updates field with comprehensive 11-line description and 7 update_details entries: Alpha v0.5, March 2025 Beta V1.4 (doi:10.18130/V3/B35XWX), June 2025 Beta V2.1 (doi:10.18130/V3/F3TD5R), quarterly augmentation through Nov 2026, future computed cell maps, final release Nov 2026, long-term preservation
sub_elements.notes: Detailed update history and future plans; errata field not present but change descriptions comprehensive

sub_elements.name: Update Schedule or Frequency Indicated
sub_elements.evidence: updates frequency: 'Quarterly updates through November 2026; long-term preservation thereafter'; description mentions 'Beta releases on quarterly basis with periodic data augmentation'
sub_elements.notes: Clear update schedule with quarterly frequency through project end

sub_elements.name: Provenance and Source Derivation Documented
sub_elements.evidence: Fields not present; provenance graphs mentioned in distribution_formats description but no was_derived_from or release_notes fields
sub_elements.notes: Provenance graphs described as part of RO-Crate packages using EVI Evidence Graph Ontology, but no top-level provenance fields

element_evaluations.element_description: Does the metadata clearly state why the dataset exists and who funded it?

sub_elements.name: Motivation or Purpose for Dataset Creation
sub_elements.evidence: 3 purposes entries: AI-Ready Cell Architecture Maps for Biomedical AI, Interpretable Genotype-Phenotype Learning, Establishing AI-Readiness Standards for Biomedical Data; each with comprehensive descriptions (5-9 lines)
sub_elements.notes: Well-articulated scientific motivations covering AI applications, interpretability, and standards

sub_elements.name: Primary Research Objectives or Tasks
sub_elements.evidence: 4 tasks entries: Multi-Scale Cell Mapping via MuSIC Pipeline, Visible Neural Network Development, Disease-Relevant Cell Line Characterization, Ethical AI Framework Development; each with detailed 5-7 line descriptions
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive task documentation covering technical, scientific, and ethical objectives

sub_elements.name: Funding Sources and Mechanisms Listed
sub_elements.evidence: funders entry with comprehensive 9-line description: NIH Common Fund Bridge2AI Program, grant 1OT2OD032742-01 (Bridge2AI Functional Genomics), grant 5U54HG012513-02 (Bridge2AI Bridge Center), NIH Office of the Director administration, Opportunity Number OTA-21-008, project dates Sept 1 2022 to Aug 31 2026, FY 2025 funding $5,289,382 ($4,632,095 direct, $657,287 indirect), Frederick Thomas Fund of UVA
sub_elements.notes: Exceptionally detailed funding information with grant numbers, amounts, dates, and sources

sub_elements.name: Grant IDs or Award Numbers Present
sub_elements.evidence: Grant numbers: 1OT2OD032742-01, 5U54HG012513-02; Opportunity Number: OTA-21-008
sub_elements.notes: Multiple grant identifiers provided with full award details

sub_elements.name: Creators and Acknowledgements Documented
sub_elements.evidence: 15 creators entries with names, roles, and institutions: Trey Ideker (Contact PI/Project Leader, UCSD), Jean-Christophe Bélisle-Pipon (Co-I, SFU, Ethics), Timothy Clark (Co-I, UVA, Standards), Jake Yue Chen (Co-I, UAB, Teaming), Nevan J Krogan (Co-I, UCSF, PPI), Emma Lundberg (Co-I, Stanford, Spatial Proteomics), Prashant Mali (Co-I, UCSD, Genetic Perturbations), and 8 additional co-investigators
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive creator documentation with roles and module leadership clearly identified

element_evaluations.element_description: Can data collection and processing steps be replicated or understood?

sub_elements.name: Collection Mechanisms and Settings Described
sub_elements.evidence: 4 collection_mechanisms entries with detailed 8-13 line descriptions: Immunofluorescence Spatial Proteomics Imaging (automated protocols, pipetting robot, antibodies from HPA, Lundberg Lab), Affinity Purification Mass Spectrometry (17 genes tagged, 34 in process, 3 conditions), Size Exclusion Chromatography Mass Spectrometry (Krogan Lab UCSF, >1000 complexes MDA-MB-468, >700 complexes iPSC), CRISPR Perturbation Screens (100 chromatin factors, 6 gRNAs/gene, 10x Genomics 3'HT, 11,739 genes total)
sub_elements.notes: Exceptionally detailed collection mechanisms with technical specifications, lab sources, and quantitative details

sub_elements.name: Data Acquisition Methods Listed
sub_elements.evidence: 4 acquisition_methods entries: Confocal Microscopy for Subcellular Imaging (4 channels, HPA deep learning model for embeddings), Mass Spectrometry for Protein Interactions (AP-MS and SEC-MS, node2vec deep learning for embeddings), Single-Cell RNA Sequencing for Perturbation Mapping (10x Genomics 3'HT, deposited to NCBI SRA), MuSIC Pipeline Integration (contrastive deep learning, community detection, hierarchical cell maps)
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive acquisition methods linking raw data collection to processed outputs with computational approaches

sub_elements.name: Preprocessing, Cleaning, and Labeling Strategies
sub_elements.evidence: 5 preprocessing_strategies entries (Deep Learning Embedding Generation, Hierarchical Community Detection, Cell Map Annotation, QC for Imaging Data, QC for Mass Spec Data) with 3-4 preprocessing_details each; 3 cleaning_strategies entries (FAIRSCAPE AI-Readiness Packaging, Data Standard Mapping, Integrative Structure Modeling Annotation) with 4-5 cleaning_details each
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive preprocessing and cleaning documentation; no labeling_strategies field but annotation approaches documented in preprocessing

sub_elements.name: Software and Tools Documented
sub_elements.evidence: Software/tools mentioned throughout: MuSIC pipeline (contrastive deep learning), node2vec (PPI embeddings), Human Protein Atlas deep learning model (image embeddings), Cytoscape (community detection), FAIRSCAPE framework (RO-Crate packaging), Gene Ontology, Reactome, PDB, AlphaFold, Schema.org, EVI Evidence Graph Ontology, 10x Genomics 3'HT kit, crosslinking mass spectrometry
sub_elements.notes: Extensive software and tool documentation integrated throughout collection, acquisition, and preprocessing sections; software_and_tools field not present as separate section but tools comprehensively documented

sub_elements.name: External Standards and Resources Referenced
sub_elements.evidence: 12 external_resources entries linking to: CM4AI website, NIH RePORTER, UVA Dataverse, bioRxiv publications, FAIRSCAPE docs, IMP platform, NDEx, Bridge2AI program, CFDE, MassIVE, NCBI SRA, Perturbation Cell Atlas publication; Standards mentioned: Gene Ontology, Reactome, PDB, AlphaFold, Schema.org, EVI, NCI Thesaurus, BioAssay Ontology, Cell Ontology, CHEBI, RO-Crate, FAIR principles
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive external resources and standards conformance; conforms_to field not present but standards extensively documented

element_evaluations.element_description: Does the metadata communicate known risks, biases, or dataset limitations?

sub_elements.name: Known Limitations Documented
sub_elements.evidence: discouraged_uses entry 'Use During Incomplete Data Release' states: 'interim/beta release with data not yet in completed final form', 'Some datasets are under temporary pre-publication embargo', 'protein interrogation sets incompletely overlap', 'computed cell maps not yet included', 'Full integration and final cell maps will be available in future releases through November 2026'
sub_elements.notes: Limitations documented in discouraged_uses; known_limitations field not present as separate section but limitations clearly disclosed

sub_elements.name: Systematic Biases Identified and Described
sub_elements.evidence: Field not present
sub_elements.notes: No known_biases field; sampling_strategies indicates non-random, non-representative selection but systematic biases not explicitly documented

sub_elements.name: Data Anomalies and Quality Issues Noted
sub_elements.evidence: Quality control mentioned in preprocessing_strategies: 'Quality control of imaging data before release', 'Data currently undergoing quality checks before public release', 'Release only after quality validation', 'Validation before public release'; discouraged_uses mentions incomplete data release status
sub_elements.notes: Quality control processes documented; anomalies field not present but quality issues and validation processes described

sub_elements.name: Sensitive Content and Warnings Provided
sub_elements.evidence: sensitive_elements entry: 'Cell Line Origin Metadata' with description explaining donor demographics retained for scientific context, sensitive_elements_present: false, sensitivity_details: de-identified commercial cell lines, cannot be matched to individuals, ethically sourced from ATCC and HipSci
sub_elements.notes: Sensitive elements documented with clear explanation of non-sensitivity; content_warnings field not present but sensitive elements addressed

sub_elements.name: Ethical Review Details Including Conflicts
sub_elements.evidence: ethics_review_board field lists: CM4AI Ethics Module (Vardit Ravitsky, Jean-Christophe Bélisle-Pipon), Data Access Committee (Jillian Parker), Bridge2AI Ethics Working Group participation; but no ethical_reviews field with conflict of interest details
sub_elements.notes: Ethics oversight documented in human_subject_research; ethical_reviews field not present and no conflict of interest disclosures

element_evaluations.element_description: Does the dataset connect to wider data ecosystems, repositories, or standards?

sub_elements.name: Dataset Published on a Recognized Platform
sub_elements.evidence: Distribution via: University of Virginia's LibraData data archive (Dataverse instance, NIH-approved generalist repository), MassIVE Repository (Proteomics community-supported), NCBI BioProject/SRA, Network Data Exchange (NDEx); license_and_use_terms mentions copyright holders: UCSD, Stanford, UCSF
sub_elements.notes: Multiple recognized platforms documented in distribution_formats; publisher field not present but publishing platforms comprehensive

sub_elements.name: Citation and DOI for Cross-referencing
sub_elements.evidence: DOI in id field: https://doi.org/10.18130/V3/DXWOS5; Additional DOIs: 10.18130/V3/B35XWX, 10.18130/V3/F3TD5R; license_and_use_terms states: 'Any publications referencing this data or derived products should cite the bioRxiv article (Clark T, et al. Cell Maps for Artificial Intelligence: AI-Ready Maps of Human Cell Architecture from Disease-Relevant Cell Lines. BioRXiv, May 2024. doi:10.1101/2024.05.21.589311) and directly cite the data collection'
sub_elements.notes: Multiple DOIs and citation guidance provided; citation field not present but citation requirements documented in license terms

sub_elements.name: Community Standards or Schema Conformance
sub_elements.evidence: Standards conformance documented: Gene Ontology (GO), Reactome, Protein Data Bank (PDB), AlphaFold Protein Structure Database, Schema.org, EVI Evidence Graph Ontology, NCI Thesaurus, BioAssay Ontology, Cell Ontology, CHEBI; RO-Crate packaging standard; FAIR principles implementation; JSON-Schema validation; ARK persistent identifiers
sub_elements.notes: Extensive standards conformance across biological, metadata, and data packaging domains; conforms_to field not present but conformance comprehensively documented

sub_elements.name: Outreach Materials and Documentation Links
sub_elements.evidence: page: https://www.cm4ai.org; external_resources: FAIRSCAPE Framework Documentation (tutorial, installation), Integrative Modeling Platform (IMP package), Bridge2AI Program, NIH Common Fund Data Ecosystem (CFDE), bioRxiv publication, Perturbation Cell Atlas publication; discouraged_uses mentions 'Training resources available through CM4AI Skills and Workforce Development module'
sub_elements.notes: Comprehensive documentation and outreach resources including project website, tutorials, training materials, and publications

sub_elements.name: Related Datasets with Typed Relationships
sub_elements.evidence: external_resources provides rich ecosystem connections: NIH RePORTER (grant context), Bridge2AI program (parent initiative), CFDE (collaboration partner), multiple data repositories (MassIVE for mass spec, NCBI SRA for sequences, NDEx for networks, Dataverse for archives), related publications (bioRxiv CM4AI paper, Perturbation Cell Atlas paper)
sub_elements.notes: Related datasets and resources documented in external_resources with contextual relationships; related_datasets field not present (flat schema) but relationships well-documented

strengths: Exceptionally comprehensive scientific documentation with 15 creators, 3 purposes, 4 tasks covering technical, scientific, and ethical objectives
Outstanding funding transparency with detailed grant numbers (1OT2OD032742-01, 5U54HG012513-02), amounts ($5.3M FY2025), dates, and multiple sources
Excellent technical transparency with 4 collection mechanisms, 4 acquisition methods, 5 preprocessing strategies, and 3 cleaning strategies, all with detailed technical specifications
Comprehensive data composition documentation with 4 instances, 7 subpopulations, and 5 data subsets covering multimodal data types
Strong ethics documentation explaining non-human subjects research status with clear ethics oversight structure (Ethics Module, Data Access Committee, Bridge2AI Ethics Working Group)
Extensive ecosystem integration with 12 external resources linking to major platforms (Dataverse, MassIVE, NCBI SRA, NDEx, FAIRSCAPE, Bridge2AI)
Excellent discovery support with persistent DOI identifier, comprehensive 243-word description, 26 keywords, and landing page
Clear licensing with detailed CC BY-NC-SA 4.0 terms, attribution requirements, commercial restrictions, and citation guidance
Strong update plan with quarterly releases through November 2026, version history (v0.5, V1.4, V2.1), and long-term preservation commitment
Comprehensive standards conformance documented across Gene Ontology, Reactome, PDB, AlphaFold, Schema.org, EVI, RO-Crate, and FAIR principles
weaknesses: Missing formal version tracking fields: no version number at top level, no version_access field documenting version retrieval methods
No provenance fields: was_derived_from and release_notes not present despite provenance graphs mentioned in RO-Crate packages
Limited variables metadata: no variables field or is_tabular field (though appropriate for multimodal imaging/mass spec/sequencing data)
No explicit regulatory_restrictions or confidentiality_level fields beyond license terms
Missing known_biases field: sampling is documented as non-random and non-representative but systematic biases not explicitly identified
No separate ethical_reviews field with conflict of interest disclosures, though ethics oversight is documented
No format and encoding fields at dataset level, though distribution formats are well-described
Flat schema limitations: no hierarchical resources, parent_datasets, or related_datasets fields with typed relationships (though external_resources provides extensive connections)
critical_gaps: Version tracking infrastructure: While update history is documented, formal version number and version access methods are absent
Provenance documentation: No top-level provenance fields despite detailed provenance graphs in RO-Crate packages
Bias disclosure: Sampling approach documented but systematic biases not explicitly identified or described
recommendations: Add top-level version field with current version number (V2.1 or later)
Add version_access field documenting how to access previous versions from Dataverse
Add was_derived_from field documenting source data and processing lineage
Add known_biases field explicitly identifying systematic biases from non-random cell line selection and treatment conditions
Add ethical_reviews field with conflict of interest disclosures for ethics oversight bodies
Consider adding format and encoding fields at dataset level for primary data formats
Consider adding publisher field explicitly naming institutional publishers (UCSD, Stanford, UCSF, UVA)
summary.overall_assessment: This is an exceptionally comprehensive D4D datasheet scoring 84% (42/50 points). The CM4AI datasheet demonstrates outstanding documentation across scientific motivation (5/5), technical methods (5/5), ethics (5/5), data composition (5/5), and ecosystem integration (5/5). The datasheet excels in funding transparency with detailed grant information, technical transparency with comprehensive method descriptions across imaging/mass spec/sequencing modalities, and ethical documentation explaining non-human subjects research status. The main gaps are in formal version tracking (2/5) and some aspects of reuse/interoperability (3/5) and limitations disclosure (3/5). Despite being a flat schema without hierarchical relationship fields, the datasheet effectively uses external_resources to document ecosystem connections. The weaknesses are primarily structural (missing specific D4D schema fields) rather than substantive (information is often documented elsewhere). With additions of version tracking, provenance fields, and explicit bias documentation, this datasheet could approach 90%+ completeness. The datasheet serves as an excellent model for documenting complex multimodal functional genomics datasets with strong AI-readiness packaging (FAIRSCAPE, RO-Crate) and standards conformance (GO, Reactome, Schema.org, EVI).
